etymologies: early 19th century: from French particularisme, modern Latin particularismus, and German Partikularismus, based on Latin particularis ‘concerning a small part’

definitions: exclusive attachment to one's own group, party, or nation.
shortDefinitions: exclusive attachment to one's own group or nation

definitions: the principle of leaving each state in an empire or federation free to govern itself and promote its own interests, without reference to those of the whole.
shortDefinitions: principle of leaving each state in empire or federation free to govern itself and promote its own interests, without reference to those of whole

definitions: the doctrine that some but not all people are elected and redeemed.
shortDefinitions: doctrine that some but not all people are elected and redeemed
